reasoning: Reporting incidence of new RA diagnoses. All incident RA cases are by definition 'early' RA at diagnosis. Global incidence approximately 25-30 per 100k person-years based on meta-analyses of population-based studies. Higher in developed countries and females. 'Early' typically refers to disease duration <2 years but incidence captures new diagnoses.
source: Alamanos Y et al. (2006). Incidence and prevalence of rheumatoid arthritis, based on the 1987 American College of Rheumatology criteria: a systematic review. Semin Arthritis Rheum. 36(3):182-188
